nodes.label: Memetic
nodes.description: Relating to memes or the study of how ideas spread and evolve within cultures. In the context of Memetic Magic, it refers to the manipulation of memes to affect change in the social matrix.

nodes.label: Social
nodes.description: A key concept in Memetic Magic appearing 221 times in the text

nodes.label: Matrix
nodes.description: A totality including everything which it contains. In Memetic Magic, matrices are used to describe various levels of social and cultural structures.

nodes.label: Social Matrix
nodes.description: The underlying structure of social reality that represents how ideas and linguistic consciousness form interconnected frameworks. It is a fundamental matrix that represents the underlying structure of social reality.

nodes.label: Structure
nodes.description: The organized arrangement of memes and thought patterns that form coherent concepts within the social matrix. Structures can be manipulated through memetic magic.

nodes.label: Thought
nodes.description: A key concept in Memetic Magic appearing 88 times in the text

nodes.label: Memetic Structure
nodes.description: A complex combination of memes that forms a coherent thought pattern or social construct. Memetic structures can be consciously engineered and downloaded into the ideosphere with the intent of causing willed change. They can be transmitted, maintained, and reproduced among target populations.

nodes.label: Manipulation
nodes.description: The process of causing change within the objective universe in accordance with subjective will. In Memetic Magic, manipulation refers specifically to altering the Root Social Matrix and the fabric of reality through the conscious engineering of memetic structures.

nodes.label: Programming
nodes.description: The process by which thought contagions and memetic structures are embedded in human consciousness. Cultural programming determines which portions of the Root Social Matrix an individual can perceive and interact with.

nodes.label: Spirit
nodes.description: Entities that possess quasi-independent wills of their own. In many cases, elements of the subconscious mind possess a measure of free will equal to that of the human ego. Spirits are real whether they are projections of the subconscious mind or not.

nodes.label: Individual
nodes.description: A key concept in Memetic Magic appearing 64 times in the text

nodes.label: Mental
nodes.description: A key concept in Memetic Magic appearing 46 times in the text

nodes.label: Subconscious
nodes.description: The part of the mind that operates below conscious awareness. The subconscious landscape remains fairly stable but is constantly under assault from thought contagions attempting to bind to subconscious mental structures.

nodes.label: Magic
nodes.description: A key concept in Memetic Magic appearing 42 times in the text

nodes.label: Evocation
nodes.description: The art and science of calling forth spirits. In Memetic Magic, evocation involves accessing the spiritual realm or subconscious mind to manifest entities or concepts.

nodes.label: Root
nodes.description: A key concept in Memetic Magic appearing 37 times in the text

nodes.label: Consciousness
nodes.description: The state of awareness and perception. In Memetic Magic, consciousness is seen as a tool that can be manipulated and expanded to access different levels of reality and the social matrix.

nodes.label: Meme
nodes.description: The basic unit of symbolic thought. Memes are the fundamental building blocks of memetic structures and the ideosphere.

nodes.label: Reality
nodes.description: The fabric of existence that can be manipulated through memetic magic. Reality is not fixed but can be altered through the manipulation of the Root Social Matrix.

nodes.label: Memetic Magic
nodes.description: A modern manifestation of shamanic practices, defined as magic performed through the manipulation of the Root Social Matrix. It is the art and science of causing change within the objective universe in accordance with the subjective will of a magician through manipulation of memes and social structures.

nodes.label: Root Social Matrix
nodes.description: The underlying conglomeration of the accumulated social and cultural influences of humanity. It consists of every element created and maintained by human sociocultural systems, including the ideosphere wherein memetic structures predominate. Much of the content contained within the RSM is unknowable to the average human.

nodes.label: Magick
nodes.description: A key concept in Memetic Magic appearing 19 times in the text

nodes.label: Cultural
nodes.description: A key concept in Memetic Magic appearing 19 times in the text

nodes.label: Contagion
nodes.description: A key concept in Memetic Magic appearing 16 times in the text

nodes.label: Thought Contagion
nodes.description: Ideas or concepts that spread from mind to mind like viruses. Thought contagions attempt to bind to subconscious mental structures, and successful penetrations alter the mental landscape. They can remain latent in memetic talismans or amulets until perceived by a human mind capable of understanding them.

nodes.label: Uninitiated
nodes.description: A key concept in Memetic Magic appearing 9 times in the text

nodes.label: Landscape
nodes.description: A key concept in Memetic Magic appearing 7 times in the text
